body_html: Yes, that's exactly what I meant. But remember to change the string given to pybind when creating the struct wrapper to have an underscore at the beginning (so that people don't think they can construct it, as it would be exposed as torch.cuda.CudaDeviceProperties)
body_text: Yes, that's exactly what I meant. But remember to change the string given to pybind when creating the struct wrapper to have an underscore at the beginning (so that people don't think they can construct it, as it would be exposed as torch.cuda.CudaDeviceProperties)
body: Yes, that's exactly what I meant. But remember to change the string given to pybind when creating the struct wrapper to have an underscore at the beginning (so that people don't think they can construct it, as it would be exposed as `torch.cuda.CudaDeviceProperties`)
